questions.text: 18. Have you undergone a mammogram?

subQuestions.text: 18a. Which of these best describes your breast density?

options.label: A: Almost entirely fatty:
options.description: (The breasts are almost all fat, with very little fibrous and glandular tissue. This makes it easy to see any abnormality on the mammogram.)

options.label: B: Scattered fibroglandular densities:
options.description: (There are areas of scattered dense or fibrous and glandular tissue, but the majority of the breast is fatty. A small mass would be visible on a mammogram.)

options.label: C: Heterogeneously dense:
options.description: (There are many areas of fibrous and glandular tissue, which makes it hard to find small masses on a mammogram. This may obscure small cancers.)

options.label: D: Extremely dense:
options.description: (The breasts are almost entirely made of dense, fibrous, and glandular tissue. This can make it very difficult to see through the breast on a mammogram. This is also associated with a higher risk of breast cancer.)

options.label: E: I don't know / I am not sure
